00015 #ifndef NINJA_EVAL_ENV_H_
00016 #define NINJA_EVAL_ENV_H_
00017 
00018 #include <map>
00019 #include <string>
00020 #include <vector>
00021 using namespace std;
00022 
00023 /// An interface for a scope for variable (e.g. "$foo") lookups.
00024 struct Env {
00025   virtual string LookupVariable(const string& var) = 0;
00026 };
00027 
00028 /// An Env which contains a mapping of variables to values
00029 /// as well as a pointer to a parent scope.
00030 struct BindingEnv : public Env {
00031   BindingEnv() : parent_(NULL) {}
00032   virtual string LookupVariable(const string& var);
00033   void AddBinding(const string& key, const string& val);
00034 
00035   map<string, string> bindings_;
00036   Env* parent_;
00037 };
00038 
00039 /// A tokenized string that contains variable references.
00040 /// Can be evaluated relative to an Env.
00041 struct EvalString {
00042   bool Parse(const string& input, string* err, size_t* err_index=NULL);
00043   string Evaluate(Env* env) const;
00044 
00045   const string& unparsed() const { return unparsed_; }
00046   const bool empty() const { return unparsed_.empty(); }
00047 
00048   string unparsed_;
00049   enum TokenType { RAW, SPECIAL };
00050   typedef vector<pair<string, TokenType> > TokenList;
00051   TokenList parsed_;
00052 };
00053 
00054 #endif  // NINJA_EVAL_ENV_H_
